channel.title: [C++]Need help with Win32 API
channel.description:
I am using [url=http://www.winprog.org/tutorial/]http://www.winprog.org/tutorial/[/url] to learn to create a GUI in C++. I understand everything up to "5. Using Resources."
It says I need to create a .rc file. I used VC++ to do that, but I don't really understand it. I dont know where to put it or anything. I also don't understand how to use the "resource.h" include.
Any help would be greatly appreciated. I need to know this so I can move on (to actually create controls + menus).

item.title: [C++]Need help with Win32 API
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“capndurk, post:1, topic:15763”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=22770.msg264327#msg264327 date=1158972068]
You should’nt use the win32 api for multiple reasons:

  1. it won’t be compatible with any other OS, including future versions of windows.
  2. windows sucks

There are other things you can use that are cross platform and better, check out GTK+ ;D
[/quote]

don’t listen to mopar, he doesn’t know what he’s talking about… the win32 api will still be used in future versions of windows, and windows doesn’t suck compared to linux and macs.

to answer your question, though, you put the resource file in with your project/workspace and you can use the format provided on theForger’s tutorial to write it up and link it with a control. you don’t need resource files to create dialogs (CreateDialog() does that) or even menus (CreateMenu() ;)), so i wouldn’t suggest even bothering with them.[/quote]
<3 windows
